jurisdiction.title: Laurent Clerc National Deaf Education Center and California School for the Deaf-Fremont

141F5AEA77334C48B628B0453A4DA8E1.description:
Fingerspell longer words and phrases following correct
contour as new ASL and English lexicon expands.

ED5E4F7B060F4FCF9D592CF54A7C0D36.description:
Know and apply grade-level parameters and sign analysis skills
in decoding signs both in isolation and in context.

BB17CB34529A4C868AED63D837C2D8CD.description:
Can fingerspell words as lexical signs (e.g., #WHAT, #BACK
#OK, #MOOD).

4C9DE9EE096C4411B42C1C386227343E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of initialized and lexicalized forms
of fingerspelled words.

312F27EF26ED4F7197639B9D50D373B9.description:
Apply understanding of partition and movement of
fingerreading units through recognition of patterns and
movement (e.g., #MEAN all in neutral movement while
#HAPPY requires both neutral and lower movement as well;
smooth as double-letters “PP”).

5CA35F743C334B6CAB3E4105A29BD4BA.description:
Demonstrate understanding of ways fingerspelled signs are
formed and their uses.

35785F6FC9C049F38DAB8F20722B8D00.description:
Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational,
general academic, and domain-specific signs and phrases,
including those that signal spatial and temporal relationships
(e.g., JUST-NOW CAR ALMOST HIT BIKE, LUCKY CL: 3 BIKESTOP-QUICK).

E09272420CEE4589B18F8076872F7834.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that
describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., KNEW,
BELIEVE, SUSPECT, HS: 1 THINK, two hands HS: 1 THINK).

E56AC4407B60442A800C51B97AFE3A79.description:
Identify real-life connections between signs and their use
(e.g., describe people who are WOW-FRIENDLY, HELP-HELP).

2A1E77D7619A494B8F50B91F85127DE3.description:
Distinguish literal and nonliteral meanings of signs and
phrases in context (e.g., READ-MIND, STUCK).

2682767FB99144FA93944BF255E74E5C.description:
Demonstrate understanding of sign relationships and nuances
in sign meanings.

DFA0CFBF331A4BBABC1D312F43D90360.description:
Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and
digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key
signs and phrases.

708E74AB61A74C919EF8C7E60669CB7B.description:
Determine the meaning of the new sign formed when a
known non-manual affix is added to a known sign (e.g.,
AGREE nms NOT).

EDEB28DA4C344D438210572BC40C1AB4.description:
Use sentence-level context to identify the meaning of
unknown, signs, fingerspelled words, and phrases.

33FB1A57496249398E470BB87BB957C5.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiplemeaning sign, fingerspelled words, and phrases based on
grade 3 signing and content, choosing flexibly from a range of
strategies.

8434E4E362AB4F5AB312C6A9CB425218.description:
Recognize and observe differences between the structure of
live and published American Sign Language.

A5C82467AC1F4FDEA0611BD5A1D02584.description: Choose fingerspelling, signs, and phrases for effect.

BD6956B36120474E9466A0DAA1DBCC97.description:
Use knowledge of language and its structure when signing
and viewing (live and published).

40E0AA9768914D4AB781619D3D41CB17.description:
Can produce, evaluate, and ensure subject-verb- object
agreement.

DC52C9966B71473286A0F753F32AB84A.description:
Produce compound sentences using negations or as
conditionals.

24F05892470A415C8547A8AD55C3ED6C.description:
Create compound sentences with indicating verbs to
demonstrate sequences of events (e.g., THEY-GAVE-US-IGIVE- HER).

9D98ECE4B7274DE19CCAD6F5029288DB.description:
Use frequently occurring prepositions through depictions,
eye gaze, and locative signs (e.g., VEHICLE-cl NEXT-TO
HOUSE, HURT-ON-TUMMY).

884AFC5443C64CF8A513D3B65D3D2CF5.description:
Use frequently occurring conjunctions (e.g., PLUS, OTHER,
FOR-FOR).

44F9F4445A044CEFB2B513C46830B2AA.description:
Use frequently occurring descriptive classifiers and other
adjectives (e.g., BPCL, LCL, MCL).

8B4810A649A5435CB3CC713C7BFBA87F.description: Utilize full breadth of signing frame space.

C4C684F13BBD47179DF06C181EEFB9BC.description:
Demonstrate command of the structure of standard ASL
grammar and usage when signing (live and published).

FA185A678B9C4234AE397DDC8FF78768.description:
Sign in complete sentences when appropriate to task and
situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.
(See grade 3 Language standards 1 and 3)

36738158CECD4439B5D7BF261D01FFB4.description:
Create engaging stories or poems that demonstrate fluid
signing at an understandable pace; add visual displays when
appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

728B1A0209C14F59A1561AA38B26D717.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience
with appropriate facts and relevant descriptive details, signing
clearly at an understandable pace.

D3963F466A2E44DAAFACDCEEBC25FEC4.description:
Ask and answer questions about information from a signer,
offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

3BFC27FF20F04DF29ADE435E1F52A6DB.description:
Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a
storytelling or storysigning or information signed or through
diverse media and formats, including quantitatively and
visually.

8E476A8B35FC485CB679AD8E2F7A5899.description:
Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the
discussion.

75013BEFCFF44A6E957E11764644D11E.description:
Ask questions to check understanding of information
presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the
remarks of others.

CC2460CF8E944239AD07F5585EA209D6.description:
Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining
the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care,
signing one at a time about the topics and texts under
discussion).

07CBE64D6E564BE9BBE1E4CFC54AABFF.description:
Come to discussions prepared, having viewed or studied
required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and
other information known about the topic to explore ideas
under discussion.

B5159BC1575C43668B721B9157DA83D6.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (e.g.,
one-on-one, in groups, teacher-led) with diverse partners
on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and
expressing their own clearly.

23CE93D7DE864BAC8DFCE8BDE2332E46.description:
Sign routinely over extended time frames (e.g., time for
research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (e.g.,
a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific
tasks, purposes, and audiences.

20414BBDAF974BD68C067A15E9180EF8.description:
Recall information from experiences or gather information
from published texts and other digital sources; take brief notes
on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.

3957DCB0F9454871A1E8617387A6E3AC.description:
Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about
a topic.

9093AB73007145D4B59C7EED7EB53FA5.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

6339F824E07341C8ABFDE2F3AA27C550.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use technology to
produce and publish signing (using editing skills) as well as to
interact and collaborate with others.

29C46A2BB42848029501540A0B983FB3.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop
and strengthen signing as needed by planning, revising, and
editing. (Editing for structure should demonstrate command of
Language standards 1-3 up to and including grade 3.)

F604CABD76504FFEB198B180329BC402.description:
With guidance and support from adults, produce clear and
coherent signing in which the development and organization
are appropriate to task and purpose. (Grade-specific
expectations for signing types are defined in standards 1-3
above.)

9512938F0F2B462CBAC68B1A06EFE0EB.description: Production and Distribution of Published Signing

265DD464D1A04D088CB01FAD19985F9C.description:
Use temporal signs, inflections, and phrases to signal event
order.

5239F9F062FA442DB68371636915F30D.description:
Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and
feelings to develop experiences and events or show the
response of characters to situations.

95E16D65B9CB464A82AD851627CDD5AE.description:
Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or
characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds
naturally.

4FFB484148BC4A3B88895492E3DCA0A4.description:
Sign narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or
events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear
event sequences.

BD2F7F7A5A1A4173B2932116B71585D5.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

BB2A3359501043369DB446D6D8DF6366.description:
Use linking signs (e.g., SAME, SECOND, UNDERSTAND++) to
connect ideas within categories of information.

B87791C8051E48D08CEA509DF809A972.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.

0E4987A5DF8148A99AD7E95B2E734CA6.description:
Sign informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and
convey ideas and information clearly.

866EBE9EBC2145FCB5CBB4594A49B5D1.description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

69F3CFD1718444389100DB3EA1533BD8.description:
Use linking signs and phrases (e.g., CL: 3-LIST, FOR-FOR-Q,
spatial referents) to connect opinion and reasons.

BE0E2352ED7F479182456BC2D620C2A0.description: Provide reasons that support the opinion.

2F2C87103F5C4F5CA314E901B93EC992.description:
Introduce the topic or text they are signing about, state an
opinion, and create an organizational structure that lists
reasons.

FB7133FB22604EB0890113909FEA6D2D.description:
Sign opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of
view with reasons.

15049508C00649EBA602117FB179DC5C.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct sign recognition and
understanding, re-viewing as necessary.

85366F37D6264FE8BEC9649AAA06076E.description:
View and recite on-level text prose and poetry with accuracy,
appropriate rate, and expression on successive viewings for
both published and live texts.

9BB9D43DFD67429E94AA43CD73D6146A.description: View on-level text with purpose and understanding.

D12F4006E4FE4BE68629B84C85E78E25.description:
View and sign on-level texts with sufficient accuracy and
fluency to support comprehension.

DC6F05B8754645C3B8ECF9229DC165BA.description:
Use combined knowledge of all parameters and morphology
(e.g., roots, affixes, and depictions) to accurately decode
unfamiliar signs and phrases in context and out of context.

2B481D5DDDD84082B5C830A19135E3DF.description:
Know and apply grade-level sign analysis skills in decoding
signs.

7027761684504A7B8219363DA8F11739.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend informational
texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical
texts, at the high end of the grades 2-3 text complexity band
independently and proficiently.

E20EBFF3DBC84FEF95AAD97983D06FAF.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

33373AC7067A48BCBC6AD581603BDF05.description:
Compare and contrast the most important points and key
details presented in two texts on the same topic.

205758B7545C472BA06ABFA8A9FB1BF0.description:
Describe the logical connection between particular sentences
and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/
second/third in a sequence).

9DC72613356748129B98099FE98822AE.description:
Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps,
photographs) and the signs in a text to demonstrate
understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how
key events occur).

995ABCD7D3AD469A999220F6E2BB38CC.description:
Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of
a text.

F2C185B894AF480A9088C2035CE17836.description:
Use text features and search tools (e.g., playback buttons,
timestamps) to locate information relevant to a given topic
efficiently.

632D23B96D9E4AABAE5A358B4D9F9992.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domainspecific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic
or subject area.

D33C248EE2C54C65B5937E4DAFCE839C.description:
Describe the relationship between a series of historical events,
scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures
in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and
cause/effect.

B22608B03675433AB001860AB8D81D7B.description:
Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and
explain how they support the main idea.

02D4A471938249C1BEBD7EC4D6B1DDBD.description:
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a
text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

BEBA8683A08A44C699D3C1F6A149C360.description:
By the end of the year, view and comprehend literature,
including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of
the grades 2-3 text complexity band independently and
proficiently.

60154C5C03B24250BC8FFC96403899DE.description: Range of Viewing and Level of Text Complexity

FD9AC97AF4AA48199E13BD205EC0011D.description:
Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of
stories created by the same author about the same or similar
characters (e.g., in videos from a series).

FA07D1E29EBB46AB958DFEBDAC16F261.description:
Explain how specific aspects of a text’s illustrations or visual
backgrounds contribute to what is conveyed by the signs in a
story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or
setting).

71268296F0C644AB94EFEE3750EB2AF0.description:
Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or
those of the characters.

3CE90149361440BA96F0FA0CA3871CE6.description:
Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when signing
about a text, using terms such as first part, beginning, chapter,
scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on
earlier sections.

723289E74532403B90097E0D75AFDE23.description:
Determine the meaning of fingerspelled words, signs, and
phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from
nonliteral language.

048F24CA3AD747C69B4B1FA142E95D1A.description:
Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations,
or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the
sequence of events.

CF1465FAA2C24C6A8DE60730B4E8DA29.description:
Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from
diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or
moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in
the text.

9E20A389B73944358AF81137F7FC30FA.description:
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a
text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.
